item.title: Dance with the one who brought you - Fixing transactions in Dynamics GP
item.description:
It seems many questions on Dynamics GP forums revolve around fixing transactions, or even worse, how fixing one transaction created more problems. When I train, I emphasize “Dance with the one who brung ‘ya,” meaning corrections should happen where the transaction originated. During my support shifts, I get asked “how do I fix this?” a lot. I always start with these questions: What’s been tried already? Often, attempts to fix the issue made it worse...

item.title: Limits on credit and holds on the sales process
item.description:
I recently wrote a blog post about sales process holds and wanted to highlight a useful benefit of using them with customer credit limits. If you’re unfamiliar with sales process holds, they are custom rules you can apply to sales documents like quotes, orders, and invoices. These holds can prevent actions such as printing, posting, fulfilling, or transferring and can be applied to individual documents, groups of documents, or specific document types...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/limits-on-credit-and-holds-on-the-sales-process/
